name: resample
content:
resample verb [T]
(IMAGE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
computing
  specialized to increase or reduce the number of pixels (= the smallest units of an image on a screen) in an image: Enlarging an image by resampling it will magnify any anomalies. The software will attempt to resample the image at different resolutions, then process it again.
More examplesFewer examplesThere is a high penalty to pay in quality if the image is resampled above 150% or below 50%.The smartphone version of the software will deliver a resampled video at a resolution the smaller device can manage. We will continue to monitor the situation and re-sample if necessary.

resample verb [T]
(SUBSTANCE)
science
  specialized to take another sample (= small amount of a substance) from someone or something in order to examine it: The soil was resampled because a child was found to have low levels of lead in her blood. Four birds were re-sampled as salmonella negative on day 13.
More examplesFewer examplesWe could get further information on salmonella-positive birds by resampling individual birds.Short-term repeatability of results was tested by resampling bait stations.
